title: Allied Pinnacle boss James Ajaka steps down
text:
The chief executive of flour, ingredients and bakery products giant Allied Pinnacle has said he is no longer kneaded (geddit), telling staff he will leave the private equity-backed business on Thursday, six months after it was sold to Japan's Nisshin for $1 billion.

James Ajaka told staff of his decision on October 8, saying he had informed managing director Takao Ouchi some months ago.

"I love the Allied Pinnacle business and am very proud of what we have achieved," Allied Pinnacle boss James Ajaka told staff. istock

Ajaka, who was hired by PEP in 2015, said in an email to staff seen by Street Talk that he had completed the major growth initiatives buyout firm PEP had set for the business four years ago, and felt that he had “given all that I can to the business and I am now in need of an extended break”.

“When I started in my role, Cathy and I had two daughters, today, we have four, it is now time for me to spend some more time with them.
description: The chief executive of flour, ingredients and bakery products giant Allied Pinnacle has told staff he will leave the private equity-backed business on Thursday.
